unit_learning_outcomes.description: Apply effective written and oral communication skills.
Apply management accounting concepts to assess and solve real-life case scenarios.
Critically analyse data to determine the relevant information and costing techniques required to make decisions.
Apply Excel spreadsheet functions to complete managerial accounting tasks.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to read the required textbook readings, complete the set homework questions and be adequately prepared to participate in activities relating to each week’s topic.

enrolment_rules.description: (ACCG611 or ACCG6011) and admission to MAccg or MAccLead or MAccg(Adv) or MCom or MProfAcc or MProfAccgLead

assessments.description: A two-hour online open book final exam will be held during the University Examination period. All key topics will be examinable.
Students will be required to complete an online quiz to be held during the session. Students are to refer to iLearn for quiz information.
One class test will be conducted during the first half of the session. The test is worth 10%.

This assessment task requires students to complete the weekly assignment questions and to participate in weekly activities conducted during seminars. Assessment marks will be awarded based on student’s performance in relation to these weekly tasks.

This assessment task requires students to complete in-class questions as required by your lecturers. Students are required to submit their answers after the class for marking and feedback. Refer to the assessment guide for detailed information for this assessment item.
Students are required to attend a three-hour workshop session. During this session students will be required to use Excel spreadsheet functions to complete managerial accounting tasks.

A three-hour closed book final examination for this unit will be held during the University Examination period. All material covered in the course will be examinable. A final examination is included as an assessment task to provide assurance that: (i) the product belongs to the student and (ii) the student has attained the knowledge and skills tested in the exam.

Students are provided with a recorded Excel virtual session, providing instructions and online materials (video tutorials, digital handouts, and Excel template). Students are then required to complete an Excel assignment addressing the key learning outcomes.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
Session 1, Special circumstances

academic_org.value: Department of Accounting and Corporate Governance

data.description: This unit focuses on the generation of information for internal decision making and examines how cost information is developed and used within organisations. A number of different costing and budgeting techniques are explained, and students are required to apply these techniques to case study scenarios. By the end of this unit, students will have developed a sophisticated level of understanding of which techniques are most appropriate in a particular situation. Students will also have developed their excel, problem-solving, communication and presentation skills.
data.title: Managerial Accounting

title: Managerial Accounting
